attributes.comment:
Dear Sir or Madam:

I am a mother of four children, three of which are adopted internationally. We are
awaiting travel on our last two children. The increase in costs on a personally level
is disheartening. We are already scraping everything we have and then some to
bring home our children. The current fees are already absurdly high for families
willing to give a child a home who would never know the joy and love of growing in
a safe, loving environment.

As a country, we should be ashamed. Are we going to punish immigrants who are
trying to enter our country legally by increasing already high fees? We want to try
to eliminate illegal entry and promote following the laws. By increasing fees, you
are discriminating against the poor immigrants. Should only the rich have access
on our country?

Most assuredly, this is discrimination against future US children. Should adoptive
parents have to pay more money on top of all the paperwork, waiting, and the
many fees just to bring home their children. This is blatant discrimination against
our internationally adopted children and their families! We are US Citizens, who
are obeying the law and following all the rules, to yet still be shoved down by our
government.

I plead with you on a moral basis not to pass this proposal. It is not the right thing
to do. Please, do the right thing for these children.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Sarah K. Rothhaar
